{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2503.23967v1", "title": "Note on $q=2$ paraparticle SYK model", "summary": "We investigate the $q=2$ SYK model with paraparticles (PSYK$_2$), analyzing
its thermodynamics and spectral form factor (SFF) using random matrix theory.
The Hamiltonian is quadratic, with coupling coefficients randomly drawn from
the Gaussian Unitary Ensemble (GUE). The model exhibits self-averaging behavior
and shows a striking transition in SFF dynamics: while the fermionic SYK$_2$
displays a ramp behavior $\mathcal{K}(t) \sim e^{C_0 t}$ with $C_0 \sim \ln N$,
the paraparticle cases exhibit $C_0 \sim \mathcal{O}(1)$. These findings offer
new insights into quantum systems with exotic statistics.", "main_category": "hep-th", "categories": "hep-th", "published": "2025-03-31T11:32:06Z"}
